biography.appearance: An average height woman with amber eyes, brown hair and a stunning beauty, which she gladly exploits to distract you from her rapier plunging into your belly.
biography.backstory:
Anja is no stranger to the cold, nor to bad weather - rain, wind, snow; nothing stops her from accomplishing the things that need to be done. Often you'll find her cutura filled with rakija, with a little missing from her morning preparations - a tradition that goes back generations. She's no lightweight drinker. Don't be fooled, however; this is no drunkard you're seeing. She's well-spoken, thoughtful, sharp-tongued when necessary, and deeply compassionate toward those she holds close. Being allowed to be close to her? Well, that's another story.

Anja holds little regard for fallen enemies, going so far as to spit on their fresh corpses. After all, if they would destroy her, why should she treat them any differently? The only honorable death is earned by living an honorable life. For those who do, Anja will take her time to send her loved ones off to the next plane with respect, dignity and good fortune. Some might say she's superstitious, but after her training in ancient ways, those who have come to know her closest insist that she's a gifted individual, capable of seeing things that nobody else can. Whether it's inherited or was cultivated in her from a young age, no mortal can truly say. One thing is clear, however, that Anja will never abandon her friends, so long as they remain honorable.
anathema: Betray oneself by ignoring beliefs and values in order to suit others
edicts: Care for close friends and family

description.value:
As an ancient people, elves have seen great change and have the perspective that can come only from watching the arc of history. After leaving the world in ancient times, they returned to a changed land, and they still struggle to reclaim their ancestral homes, most notably from terrible demons that have invaded parts of their lands. To some, the elves are objects of aweâ€”graceful and beautiful, with immense talent and knowledge. Among themselves, however, the elves place far more importance on personal freedom than on living up to these ideals.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.45SK8rdbbxvEHfMn.JournalEntryPage.3cfdiId1IoxLsF9V]{Elf}
You were born or spent many years in underground tunnels or caverns where light is scarce. You gain darkvision.

Prerequisite Region - Golden Road

You're from Rahadoum, where the Laws of Mortality taught you to reject the gods, yet you've seen firsthand how dangerous it can be to go without healing magic. As a result, you've thrown yourself into the study of medicine, so you can save lives without saving souls.

Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Wisdom or Dexterity, and one is a free ability boost.

You're trained in the Medicine skill and the Anatomy Lore skill. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.wYerMk6F1RZb0Fwt]{Battle Medicine} skill feat.

This kit of bandages, herbs, and suturing tools is necessary for Medicine checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TC7OcDa7JlWbqMaN]{Treat Disease}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.KjoCEEmPGTeFE4hh]{Treat Poison}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}. If you wear your healer's toolkit, you can draw and replace it as part of the action that uses it.

You need a thieves' toolkit to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' toolkit is broken, you can repair it by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your toolkit; this doesn't require using the Repair action. If you wear your thieves' toolkit, you can draw and replace it as part of the action that uses it.
An ancient relic from Anja's family, representing the aspectsÂ of Life and Death. Anja will never let another being take this necklace from her while she has life in her.
Hand-crafted by Anja's family, this jelek was given to Anja on her 133rd birthday.
Inside are valueless dukats from an era long past.
Used in a ritual whereby a close friend or relative has fallen and the coin serves as payment to usher the soul of the fallen to its final place of rest by being placed on the eyes of the fallen.
No better way to hold your rakija!
Popular drink from the homeland, made just the way you remember.

A braided, red thread around Anja's left wrist to ward against evil spirits, negative energy, and invite good fortune. This particular bracelet was given to her as a parting gift by her grandmother when Anja left to begin adventuring.
Leather lamellar is a composite armor made of small rectangular pieces of lacquered leather laced together with high-quality cord. It's typically worn with an undershirt.
The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.
Your muscles are tightly honed. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

Requirements You're holding or wearing a healer's toolkit.

You can patch up wounds, even in combat. Attempt a Medicine check with the same DC as for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds} and restore the corresponding amount of HP; this doesn't remove the wounded condition. As with Treat Wounds, you can attempt checks against higher DCs if you have the minimum proficiency rank. The target is then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.2XEYQNZTCGpdkyR6]{immune} to your Battle Medicine for 1 day. This does not make them immune to, or otherwise count as, Treat Wounds.

A backpack holds up to 4 Bulk of items and the first 2 Bulk of these items don't count against your Bulk limits. If you're carrying or stowing the pack rather than wearing it on your back, its Bulk is light instead of negligible
50 feet of rope.
When it's full, a waterskin contains roughly 1 day's worth of water for a Small or Medium creature.

Flint and steel are useful in creating a fire if you have the time to catch a spark, though using them is typically too time-consuming to be practical during an encounter. Even in ideal conditions, using flint and steel to light a flame requires using at least 3 actions, and often significantly longer.
A torch sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 1 hour. It can be used as an improvised weapon that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage plus 1 fire damage.
A rolled up bed.
Bar of soap.
You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-lifeblade.lifeblade.Item.JWies5HHDoiigwZx]{Pour Life} gambit cantrip, which restores health to yourself or an ally.

You use your mystical and marshal gifts to heal allies and harm foes. Using ancient techniques, you siphon the life from enemies and use that energy to provide respite to your allies in even the most dangerous of times.

During Combat Encountersâ€¦

You enter various stances to heal, protect or bolster your allies. You are nimble and in the front line, eager to disrupt your enemy's plans.

During Social Encountersâ€¦

You see things others seem to overlook. Your seemingly endless knowledge intimidates some.

While Exploringâ€¦

Knowledable in ancient arts, the information you recall so readily is seen as occult in nature to most. Regardless, your allies are glad to have you on their side, rather than the other way around.

In Downtimeâ€¦

You study ancient texts, attempt to improve your unique fighting techniques and serve as a guide for tourists, able to cite historical knowledge like you were reading it off of the page.

You Mightâ€¦

  • Commune with your ancestors in seclusion, seeking their wisdom and guidance.

  • Feel a strong sense of duty to your people and loyalty to your friends and companions.

  • Do things that are difficult or uncomfortable for others to do, such as stand up to a person who appears to be stronger than yourself.

Others Probablyâ€¦

  • Are put at ease knowing that you're there to protect them.

Gambit Spells

In the heat of combat, and while in a trance, you see, hear and feel things that none other can - the very life force of nearby creatures. After striking an opponent, you may perform a gambit, allowing you to manipulate this life force. Gambits are a special type of spell which often require you to successfully strike an enemy before they can be cast. Gambit spells are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the Refocus activity to commune with your ancesters, read ancient texts, or otherwise meditate upon the wisdom of the past.

Your gambit spells are occult spells. You become trained in occult spell attacks and occult spell DCs and your key spellcasting ability is Dexterity.

Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up, much like cantrips. Focus spells don't require spell slots, and you can't cast them using spell slots. Taking feats can give you more focus spells and increase the size of your focus pool, though your focus pool can never hold more than 3 Focus Points. The full rules for focus spells are foundÂ here.

You learn the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-lifeblade.lifeblade.Item.c1ZnisEFFdVrG56s]{Tap Self} gambit spell, allowing you to tap into your own essence to empower your weapon.

Gambit Cantrips

Gambit cantrips are special gambit spells that don't cost Focus Points, so you can use them as often as you like. You cannot swap out gambit cantrips gained from lifeblade feats unless you swap out the specific feat via retraining.
You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-lifeblade.lifeblade.Item.Oryif7MNs0NWZClX]{Life Trance} lifeblade feat.

You feel a particular connection with the life force of those around you, and use this connection to siphon life energy from foes in order to send it to nearby allies. You enter the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-lifeblade.lifeblade.Item.LsF7CkAmRd8udPUS]{Life Trance} stance.

When you successfully Strike a living creature while in this stance, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-lifeblade.lifeblade.Item.z5VLT1EqoEKuocfQ]{Life Trance Aura}, which grants you and allies within 5 feet @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-lifeblade.lifeblade.Item.QDWA51YS3fAxm1OI]{Life Trance Healing}.

With great concentration, you pull even more life essence from the creature. You redirect this energy to yourself, or 1 willing ally within 30 feet of both the creature and yourself, healing the target for 1d4+1 hit points.

Hightening (+1) Increase the healing done by 1d4+1.

system.requirements: You made a successful strike against 1 living creature earlier this round. You have not cast Pour Life this round.

range.value: You, or any willing creature within 30 feet of the struck creature

description.value:
You tap into your own essence to empower your weapon or unarmed attack. The next Strike made with the chosen weapon or unarmed attack before the start of your next turn gains a +1 status bonus to the attack roll, and the weapon or unarmed strike deals an additional die of damage.

If the chosen weapon leaves your possession,Â tap self ends immediately.

Apply @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-lifeblade.lifeblade.Item.pfyRa0e37H5rEIjJ]{Effect: Tap Self} to yourself.
